itemLabel: Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor

wikipedia_page.main: Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor, DL (28 April 1924 – 29 July 2010) was a British peer. He sat as a crossbencher in the House of Lords.

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: ***Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor, grandson of David, active Crossbench member of the House of Lords 1968 – 1999.
*Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor (1924–2010)
*** 15px Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor (1924–2010)
The house, in 20 acres of woodland, was bought and restored from 1987 onwards by Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor and remains (2013) in the Lloyd George family.
*Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor (1924–2010),  British Peer and crossbencher

On 21 August 1889, McAlpine married Florence Margaret Palmer and had one son: Archibald Douglas (1890–1981) and two daughters, Emma and Roberta. Roberta married Richard Lloyd George and was the mother of Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor.

link_mentions.page: List of children of prime ministers of the United Kingdom
response: *Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor

The house, in 20 acres of woodland, was bought and restored from 1988 onwards by Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor and his wife, who are credited with saving the house. After the death of the 3rd Earl in 2010 the house was put up for sale with an asking price of £2.5 million. The house was sold again in July 2021.
*Owen Lloyd George, 3rd Earl Lloyd-George of Dwyfor (1924–2010), British peer
